item.title: Fixing Layout issues after forcing HTTPS on GitHub Pages for a Jekyll based site
item.description: Don't forget to update the CSS! I had been meaning to set up my blog page to use SSL/HTTPS for a while. Today I did it. It's amazingly simple since Github Pages has teamed up with LetsEncrypt. So I just had to tick one box. Go to your Github pages Repo, in my case https://github.com/MrCNeale/mrcneale.github.io, and select the settings tab, or go to your repo /settings, https://github.com/MrCNeale/mrcneale.github.io/settings Once there simply scroll down to the Github Pages section and tick the box labelled "
